content.text:
‚úÖ **Problema resolvido!**

O erro era causado por uma incompatibilidade entre React 19.1.0 e @tanstack/react-query 5.77.0. O React Query ainda n√£o suporta completamente o React 19.

**Solu√ß√£o aplicada:**
- Downgrade do React de 19.1.0 ‚Üí 18.3.1
- Downgrade do React DOM de 19.1.0 ‚Üí 18.3.1  
- Atualiza√ß√£o dos tipos TypeScript correspondentes

A aplica√ß√£o agora est√° rodando em `http://localhost:5174/` (porta 5173 estava em uso). O erro `TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'useEffect')` foi corrigido.

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Set the port to 9999
export A2A_PORT=9999

# Navigate to the directory
cd "$(dirname "$0")"

# Start the server
echo "Starting Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999..."
node a2a-server.js

content.content:
1‚Üí#!/bin/bash
     2‚Üí# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
     3‚Üí# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üíecho "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
     6‚Üíecho "===================================="
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üí# Colors for output
     9‚ÜíGREEN='\033[0;32m'
    10‚ÜíYELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    11‚ÜíRED='\033[0;31m'
    12‚ÜíBLUE='\033[0;34m'
    13‚ÜíNC='\033[0m' # No Color
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí# Get script directory
    16‚ÜíSCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
    17‚Üícd "$SCRIPT_DIR"
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí# Set log and pid directory
    20‚ÜíLOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
    21‚Üímkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí# Set port
    24‚ÜíPORT=9999
    25‚ÜíNAME="HelloWorld"
    26‚ÜíPID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
    27‚ÜíLOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí# Check if already running
    30‚Üíif [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    31‚Üí    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    32‚Üí    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    33‚Üí        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
    34‚Üí        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
    35‚Üí        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    36‚Üí        exit 0
    37‚Üí    else
    38‚Üí        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
    39‚Üí        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    40‚Üí    fi
    41‚Üífi
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí# Check if port is available
    44‚Üíif lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    45‚Üí    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    46‚Üí    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    47‚Üí    exit 1
    48‚Üífi
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üíecho -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí# Activate virtual environment if exists
    53‚Üíif [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    54‚Üí    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    55‚Üí    source .venv/bin/activate
    56‚Üíelif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    57‚Üí    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    58‚Üí    source ../.venv/bin/activate
    59‚Üífi
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí# Start the server
    62‚Üíecho -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
    65‚Üíif command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    66‚Üí    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    67‚Üí    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
    68‚Üíelse
    69‚Üí    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    70‚Üí    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
    71‚Üífi
    72‚Üí
    73‚ÜíPID=$!
    74‚Üíecho $PID > "$PID_FILE"
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí# Wait for server to start
    77‚Üíecho -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
    78‚Üísleep 3
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí# Verify server started
    81‚Üíif ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    82‚Üí    # Test discovery endpoint
    83‚Üí    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    84‚Üí        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
    85‚Üí        echo ""
    86‚Üí        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
    87‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
    88‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
    89‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
    90‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
    91‚Üí        echo ""
    92‚Üí        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
    93‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
    94‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
    95‚Üí        echo ""
    96‚Üí        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
    97‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
    98‚Üí        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Script to run Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999

# Kill any existing process on port 9999
echo "üîç Checking for existing processes on port 9999..."
lsof -ti:9999 | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || true

# Wait a moment
sleep 1

# Set port
export A2A_PORT=9999

# Navigate to script directory
cd "$(dirname "$0")"

# Create log file
LOG_FILE="helloworld-9999.log"

# Start server in background
echo "üöÄ Starting Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999..."
nohup node server-stable.js > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

# Get PID
PID=$!
echo $PID > helloworld-9999.pid

# Wait for server to start
sleep 2

# Check if server is running
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null; then
    echo "‚úÖ Server started successfully!"
    echo "üìç Server running at: http://localhost:9999"
    echo "üìÑ PID: $PID (saved to helloworld-9999.pid)"
    echo "üìã Logs: tail -f $LOG_FILE"
    echo ""
    echo "To stop the server: kill $PID"
    echo "Or use: kill \$(cat helloworld-9999.pid)"
else
    echo "‚ùå Failed to start server. Check $LOG_FILE for errors."
    exit 1
fi

from a2a.server.apps import A2AStarletteApplication
from a2a.server.request_handlers import DefaultRequestHandler

# HelloWorld A2A Agent

Um agente A2A (Agent-to-Agent) de exemplo para demonstra√ß√£o e teste do protocolo A2A Protocol.

## üìã Vis√£o Geral

Este projeto implementa um agente HelloWorld seguindo o **A2A Protocol** do Google, demonstrando comunica√ß√£o b√°sica entre agentes de IA. O agente responde a mensagens com sauda√ß√µes personalizadas e serve como base para desenvolvimento de agentes mais complexos.

## üèóÔ∏è Arquitetura A2A

Baseado nos **componentes principais do A2A Protocol**:

1. **Agent Registry**: Registro e descoberta de agentes
2. **Communication Layer**: Comunica√ß√£o HTTP/WebSocket 
3. **Capability Description**: Descri√ß√£o padronizada de habilidades
4. **Security Layer**: Autentica√ß√£o e criptografia
5. **Negotiation Protocol**: Negocia√ß√£o de colabora√ß√£o

## üìÅ Estrutura do Projeto

```
helloworld/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                    # Documenta√ß√£o
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ specification/           # Configura√ß√µes A2A
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_card.json     # Card do agente
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ a2a-config.json     # Configura√ß√£o A2A
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                     # C√≥digo principal
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server.py           # Servidor Python (porta 9999)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server-stable.js    # Servidor Node.js (porta 9999)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent.py            # L√≥gica do agente Python
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_executor.py   # Executor de tarefas
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents/                  # Agentes JavaScript
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ helloworld_agent.js # Implementa√ß√£o do agente
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.js            # √çndice dos agentes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/                 # Scripts utilit√°rios
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ start_helloworld.sh # Iniciar agente Python
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ stop_helloworld.sh  # Parar agente Python
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logs/                    # Logs e PIDs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_cards/            # Cards adicionais
```

## üöÄ Como Usar

### Python Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
./scripts/start_helloworld.sh
```

### Node.js Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
node src/server-stable.js
```

## üîó Endpoints A2A

- **Discovery**: `/.well-known/agent.json`
- **API Docs**: `/docs` 
- **Health**: `/health`

toolUseResult.content:
# HelloWorld A2A Agent

Um agente A2A (Agent-to-Agent) de exemplo para demonstra√ß√£o e teste do protocolo A2A Protocol.

## üìã Vis√£o Geral

Este projeto implementa um agente HelloWorld seguindo o **A2A Protocol** do Google, demonstrando comunica√ß√£o b√°sica entre agentes de IA. O agente responde a mensagens com sauda√ß√µes personalizadas e serve como base para desenvolvimento de agentes mais complexos.

## üèóÔ∏è Arquitetura A2A

Baseado nos **componentes principais do A2A Protocol**:

1. **Agent Registry**: Registro e descoberta de agentes
2. **Communication Layer**: Comunica√ß√£o HTTP/WebSocket 
3. **Capability Description**: Descri√ß√£o padronizada de habilidades
4. **Security Layer**: Autentica√ß√£o e criptografia
5. **Negotiation Protocol**: Negocia√ß√£o de colabora√ß√£o

## üìÅ Estrutura do Projeto

```
helloworld/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                    # Documenta√ß√£o
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ specification/           # Configura√ß√µes A2A
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_card.json     # Card do agente
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ a2a-config.json     # Configura√ß√£o A2A
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                     # C√≥digo principal
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server.py           # Servidor Python (porta 9999)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server-stable.js    # Servidor Node.js (porta 9999)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent.py            # L√≥gica do agente Python
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_executor.py   # Executor de tarefas
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents/                  # Agentes JavaScript
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ helloworld_agent.js # Implementa√ß√£o do agente
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.js            # √çndice dos agentes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/                 # Scripts utilit√°rios
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ start_helloworld.sh # Iniciar agente Python
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ stop_helloworld.sh  # Parar agente Python
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logs/                    # Logs e PIDs
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ agent_cards/            # Cards adicionais
```

## üöÄ Como Usar

### Python Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
./scripts/start_helloworld.sh
```

### Node.js Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
node src/server-stable.js
```

## üîó Endpoints A2A

- **Discovery**: `/.well-known/agent.json`
- **API Docs**: `/docs` 
- **Health**: `/health`
- **Messages**: `/messages`

## üéØ Caracter√≠sticas

- ‚úÖ **Offline-First**: Funciona sem conex√£o
- ‚úÖ **Async-first**: Suporte nativo a opera√ß√µes ass√≠ncronas
- ‚úÖ **Agn√≥stico √† modalidade**: Funciona com diferentes tipos de dados
- ‚úÖ **Execu√ß√£o Opaca**: Agentes interagem sem compartilhar l√≥gica interna
- ‚úÖ **Pronto para empresa**: Seguro e confi√°vel

## üìö Recursos A2A

- **Website Oficial**: [a2aprotocol.ai](https://a2aprotocol.ai)
- **GitHub**: [github.com/google/A2A](https://github.com/google/A2A)
- **Documenta√ß√£o**: [a2aprotocol.ai/docs](https://a2aprotocol.ai/docs/)

## üõ†Ô∏è Tecnologias

- **Python**: FastAPI, Uvicorn, Pydantic
- **Node.js**: Express, CORS, Body-parser
- **Protocolos**: HTTP, JSON-RPC, SSE
- **Padr√µes**: A2A Protocol, OpenAPI

## üìù Logs

Os logs s√£o salvos em:
- Python: `logs/HelloWorld.log`
- Node.js: `helloworld-9999.log`

- **Frontend**: ‚úÖ Online  
- **Banco Local**: ‚úÖ Ativo
- **A2A Registry**: ‚úÖ Ativo

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

lines: # Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

[project]
name = "helloworld"
version = "0.2.0"
description = "HelloWorld agent completo - migra√ß√£o de hello_world + funcionalidades avan√ßadas"
readme = "README.md"
requires-python = ">=3.10"
dependencies = [
    "a2a-sdk[sqlite]>=0.2.6",
    "click>=8.1.8",
    "dotenv>=0.9.9",
    "httpx>=0.28.1",
    "langchain-google-genai>=2.1.4",
    "langgraph>=0.4.1",
    "pydantic>=2.11.4",
    "python-dotenv>=1.1.0",
    "uvicorn>=0.34.2",
    # Depend√™ncias adicionais para funcionalidades avan√ßadas
    "numpy>=1.24.0",
    "pandas>=2.0.0",
    "sqlalchemy>=2.0.0"
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0.0",
    "black>=23.0.0", 
    "flake8>=6.0.0",
    "mypy>=1.0.0"
]

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["."]

[build-system]

[tool.mypy]

warn_unused_configs = true

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Shutdown Script

echo "üõë Stopping HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"
PORT=9999

echo -e "${BLUE}üîç Looking for HelloWorld Agent...${NC}"

# Try to stop using PID file
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Found HelloWorld Agent (PID: $PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Sending SIGTERM...${NC}"
        kill $PID
        
        # Wait for graceful shutdown
        for i in {1..5}; do
            if ! ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent stopped gracefully${NC}"
                rm -f "$PID_FILE"
                break
            fi
            sleep 1
        done
        
        # Force kill if still running
        if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Process still running, forcing shutdown...${NC}"
            kill -9 $PID
            sleep 1
            if ! ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent stopped (forced)${NC}"
            else
                echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to stop HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        rm -f "$PID_FILE" 2>/dev/null
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  PID file exists but process not running${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Cleaning up stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  No PID file found${NC}"
fi

# Check if port is still in use
echo -e "${BLUE}üîç Checking port $PORT...${NC}"
if lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    PID=$(lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN)
    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Found process on port $PORT (PID: $PID)${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Killing process...${NC}"
    kill $PID 2>/dev/null
    sleep 1
    if ! lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is now free${NC}"
    else
        kill -9 $PID 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT freed (forced)${NC}"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is already free${NC}"
fi

# Clean up any stray python processes running server.py in this directory
echo -e "${BLUE}üîç Looking for stray server.py processes...${NC}"
STRAY_PIDS=$(pgrep -f "python.*$SCRIPT_DIR/server.py")
if [ ! -z "$STRAY_PIDS" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Found stray processes: $STRAY_PIDS${NC}"
    kill $STRAY_PIDS 2>/dev/null
    sleep 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Stray processes cleaned${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ No stray processes found${NC}"
fi

# Cleanup options
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}üßπ Cleanup Options${NC}"
echo "==================="
read -p "Do you want to clean up log files? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
echo
if [[ $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
    if [ -f "$LOG_FILE" ]; then
        # Create backup
        mv "$LOG_FILE" "$LOG_FILE.backup" 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Log file backed up to $LOG_FILE.backup${NC}"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${BLUE}üìù Log files preserved${NC}"
fi

# Summary
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}üéØ Shutdown Summary${NC}"
echo "==================="
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent stopped${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is free${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ PID file cleaned${NC}"

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}üí° Next Steps:${NC}"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Start agent again: ./start_helloworld.sh"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ View old logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE.backup\" (if backed up)"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Check port status: lsof -i:$PORT"

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}üõë HelloWorld shutdown complete!${NC}"

lines: -read -p "Do you want to clean up log files? (y/N): " -n 1 -r

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server..."
echo "============================================"

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorldJS"
PID_FILE="logs/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="logs/${NAME}.log"

# Create logs directory
mkdir -p logs

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Node.js Server is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Check if node_modules exists
if [ ! -d "node_modules" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Node.js dependencies...${NC}"
    npm install
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Node.js Server on port $PORT...${NC}"
nohup node src/server-stable.js > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test server endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Node.js Server started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Server Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Node.js Server"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Health: http://localhost:$PORT/health"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop server: ./scripts/stop_nodejs.sh"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Node.js Server is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Node.js Server${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server Shutdown Script

echo "üõë Stopping HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server..."
echo "============================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set variables
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorldJS"
PID_FILE="logs/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="logs/${NAME}.log"

echo -e "${BLUE}üîç Looking for HelloWorld Node.js Server...${NC}"

# Check PID file
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Found HelloWorld Node.js Server (PID: $PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üî´ Stopping process...${NC}"
        
        # Try graceful shutdown first
        kill $PID 2>/dev/null
        sleep 2
        
        # Force kill if still running
        if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üíÄ Force killing process...${NC}"
            kill -9 $PID 2>/dev/null
        fi
        
        # Remove PID file
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Node.js Server stopped${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  PID file exists but process not running${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  No PID file found${NC}"
fi

# Check port
echo -e "${BLUE}üîç Checking port $PORT...${NC}"
PORT_PID=$(lsof -ti:$PORT 2>/dev/null)
if [ -n "$PORT_PID" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üî´ Killing process on port $PORT (PID: $PORT_PID)...${NC}"
    kill -9 $PORT_PID 2>/dev/null
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is now free${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is already free${NC}"
fi

# Auto-cleanup logs (no confirmation)
REPLY="y"
if [[ $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
    if [ -f "$LOG_FILE" ]; then
        # Create backup
        mv "$LOG_FILE" "$LOG_FILE.backup" 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Log file backed up to $LOG_FILE.backup${NC}"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}üéØ Shutdown Summary${NC}"
echo "==================="
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Node.js Server stopped${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is free${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ PID file cleaned${NC}"

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}üí° Next Steps:${NC}"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Start server again: ./scripts/start_nodejs.sh"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ View old logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE.backup\" (if backed up)"
echo "   ‚Ä¢ Check port status: lsof -i:$PORT"

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}üõë HelloWorld Node.js shutdown complete!${NC}"

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output

NC='\033[0m' # No Color

SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then

        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"

# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'

RED='\033[0;31m'

NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"

        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"

fi

    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script  
# Starts HelloWorld agent using A2A Protocol standard

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port (A2A default is dynamic, check server.py for actual port)
PORT=9999  # Actual port used by A2A server
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv (A2A standard) - build issues fixed
echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server (A2A standard)${NC}"
nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script  
# Starts HelloWorld agent using A2A Protocol standard

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port (A2A default is dynamic, check server.py for actual port)
PORT=9999  # Actual port used by A2A server
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"

        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script  
# Starts HelloWorld agent using A2A Protocol standard

echo "üöÄ Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port (A2A default is dynamic, check server.py for actual port)
PORT=9999  # Actual port used by A2A server
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}üì¶ Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}ü§ñ Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚è≥ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìä Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üîó Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}üìã Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Stop agent: ./scripts/stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   ‚Ä¢ Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéØ HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Using uv to run server${NC}"

content.text:
========================
CODE SNIPPETS
========================
TITLE: A2A Protocol Overview
DESCRIPTION: Describes the Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol as an open standard for AI agent communication, emphasizing interoperability and collaboration. It also explains its relationship with the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol:
  Purpose: Enables seamless communication and collaboration between AI agents.
  Key Features:
    - Interoperability: Connects agents built on different platforms (e.g., LangGraph, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel).
    - Complex Workflows: Facilitates delegation, information exchange, and coordination between agents.
    - Security & Opacity: Agents interact without sharing internal memory, tools, or proprietary logic.

Model Context Protocol (MCP):
  Purpose: Connects agents to tools, APIs, and resources with structured inputs/outputs.
  Role: The way agents access their capabilities.

Relationship between A2A and MCP:
  - Complementary standards for building robust agentic applications.
  - MCP handles tool access; A2A handles peer-to-peer agent communication.

Related Resources:
  - ADK (Agent Development Kit)
  - Python Tutorial
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Core Concepts
DESCRIPTION: Explains fundamental concepts governing A2A communication, including context management, transport protocols, authentication, agent discovery, and extensibility.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/key-concepts.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Core Concepts:

-   **Context (`contextId`):**
    -   **Description:** A server-generated identifier used to logically group multiple related `Task` objects, providing continuity across a series of interactions.

-   **Transport and Format:**
    -   **Description:** A2A communication occurs over HTTP(S). JSON-RPC 2.0 is the standard payload format for all requests and responses.

-   **Authentication & Authorization:**
    -   **Description:** A2A relies on standard web security practices. Authentication requirements are declared in the Agent Card. Credentials (e.g., OAuth tokens, API keys) are passed via HTTP headers, separate from A2A protocol messages.
    -   **Related:** Enterprise-Ready Features (`./enterprise-ready.md`).

-   **Agent Discovery:**
    -   **Description:** The process by which clients locate Agent Cards to identify available A2A Servers and their capabilities.
    -   **Related:** Agent Discovery (`./agent-discovery.md`).

-   **Extensions:**
    -   **Description:** A2A supports custom protocol extensions declared by agents within their AgentCard.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Protocol Core Concepts
DESCRIPTION: Defines the fundamental components and structures used in the Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol for communication between agents. This includes the roles of actors, the Agent Card for discovery, and the lifecycle and structure of tasks, messages, parts, and artifacts.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/key-concepts.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
A2A Protocol Concepts:

Core Actors:
  - User: Initiates requests or goals requiring agent assistance.
  - A2A Client (Client Agent): Acts on behalf of the user, initiating communication via A2A protocol.
  - A2A Server (Remote Agent): Exposes an HTTP endpoint implementing A2A, processes requests, and returns results.

Fundamental Communication Elements:

Agent Card:
  - Description: JSON metadata document, typically at `/.well-known/agent.json`.
  - Purpose: Describes an A2A Server, enabling clients to discover and understand how to interact.
  - Content:
    - Identity: Name, description.
    - Service Endpoint URL.
    - Version.
    - Supported A2A Capabilities: Streaming, push notifications.
    - Skills offered.
    - Default input/output modalities.
    - Authentication requirements.
  - Reference: Protocol Specification: Agent Card.

Task:
  - Description: A stateful unit of work initiated by a client request.
  - Lifecycle: Progresses through defined states (e.g., `submitted`, `working`, `input-required`, `completed`, `failed`).
  - Nature: Stateful, can involve multiple message exchanges between client and server.
  - Reference: Life of a Task, Protocol specification: Task Object.

Message:
  - Description: A single turn or unit of communication between a client and an agent.
  - Structure:
    - `messageId`: Unique identifier for the message set by the sender.
    - `role`: Sender's role (`"user"` for client, `"agent"` for server).
    - `parts`: One or more `Part` objects carrying the content.
  - Purpose: Conveying instructions, context, questions, answers, or status updates.
  - Reference: Protocol Specification: Message Object.

Part:
  - Description: The fundamental unit of content within a `Message` or `Artifact`.
  - Types:
    - `TextPart`: Plain textual content.
    - `FilePart`: Represents a file (inline base64 or URI reference) with metadata (filename, Media Type).
    - `DataPart`: Carries structured JSON data.
  - Reference: Protocol Specification: Part Union Type.

Artifact:
  - Description: A tangible output or result generated by the remote agent during task processing.
  - Examples: Generated documents, images, spreadsheets, structured data.
  - Structure: Composed of one or more `Part` objects.
  - Capability: Can be streamed incrementally.
  - Reference: Protocol Specification: Artifact Object.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Data Structures
DESCRIPTION: Defines the data structures used within the A2A protocol for representing parts of artifacts, file references, task artifacts, authentication, push notifications, and message parameters.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/llms.txt#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Part:
  type: "data"
  data: (any) Structured data in JSON-serializable format.
  mimeType: (string) Format specification (e.g., "application/json").
  inline: (boolean) Whether the data should be displayed inline (optional).
  metadata: (object | null) Optional metadata for the specific part.

FileWithUri:
  name: (string) Filename with extension.
  mimeType: (string) Content type (Media Type).
  uri: (string) URI to access the file content.

Artifact:
  artifactId: (string) Unique identifier for the artifact.
  name: (string) Human-readable artifact name (optional).
  description: (string) Detailed description of the artifact (optional).
  parts: (Part[]) Content segments in the artifact.
  metadata: (object) Custom key-value data (optional).
  kind: ("artifact") Type discriminator.

AuthenticationInfo:
  schemes: (string[]) Array of authentication scheme names the caller must use.
  credentials: (string) Optional static credentials or scheme-specific configuration info.

PushNotificationConfig:
  url: (string) Endpoint URL for the agent to POST notifications to.
  token: (string) Optional authentication token for the agent to include in requests (optional).
  authentication: (AuthenticationInfo) Authentication details the agent needs to call the URL (optional).

TaskPushNotificationConfig:
  taskId: (string) The task ID to receive push notifications for.
  config: (PushNotificationConfig) The push notification configuration to use.
  metadata: (object) Custom key-value data for client use (optional).

MessageSendParams:
  message: (Message) The message to send.
  configuration: (MessageSendConfiguration) Optional configuration for the message.
  metadata: (object) Custom key-value data for client use (optional).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Message and Part Structure
DESCRIPTION: Defines the structure of communication turns within the A2A protocol. A Message consists of roles and Parts, where Parts represent the smallest unit of content, such as Text, File, or Data.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
A2A Message and Part Structure:

Message:
  - A communication turn between a client and a remote agent.
  - Contains a `role` ('user' or 'agent') and one or more `Parts`.

Part:
  - The smallest unit of content within a Message or Artifact.
  - Examples of Part types:
    - TextPart: For textual content.
    - FilePart: For file references or content.
    - DataPart: For structured data.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A and MCP Protocol Comparison
DESCRIPTION: Details the complementary roles of the Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A) and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) in agentic systems. A2A focuses on agent-to-agent communication and collaboration, while MCP standardizes interaction with external resources like tools and APIs. They work together by A2A agents delegating tasks to other agents, which may then use MCP to interact with underlying tools.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_67

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Protocol Comparison:

Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A):
  Focus: Standardizing communication and collaboration between independent AI agents.
  Functionality: Agent discovery, negotiation of modalities, task management, exchange of conversational context and results.
  Analogy: How agents partner or delegate work.

Model Context Protocol (MCP):
  Focus: Standardizing how AI models and agents connect to and interact with external resources (tools, APIs, data sources).
  Functionality: Describing tool capabilities, passing inputs, receiving structured outputs.
  Analogy: The "how-to" for an agent to use a specific capability or access a resource.

Synergy:
  An A2A client agent requests a task from an A2A server agent.
  The server agent may use MCP to interact with multiple underlying tools or APIs to fulfill the A2A task.

Reference: https://modelcontextprotocol.io/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Protocol JSON-RPC Structures
DESCRIPTION: Defines the core JSON-RPC 2.0 message structures used by the A2A protocol for requests, responses, and errors. This includes details on the base message, request format with methods and parameters, response format with results or errors, and error object structure.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/llms.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
JSONRPCMessage:
  jsonrpc: "2.0" (string, required)
  id: (string | number | null, optional) Unique identifier for request/response correlation.

JSONRPCRequest:
  Inherits from JSONRPCMessage.
  method: (string, required) Operation identifier (e.g., "tasks/send").
  params: (object | array, optional) Parameters for the method.

JSONRPCResponse:
  Inherits from JSONRPCMessage.
  result: (any | null, optional) Successful result data. Mutually exclusive with error.
  error: (JSONRPCError, optional) Error object if the request failed. Mutually exclusive with result.

JSONRPCError:
  code: (integer, required) Integer error code.
  message: (string, required) String description of the error.
  data: (any, optional) Additional error details.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: A2A Interaction Mechanisms
DESCRIPTION: Details the primary methods for client-server interaction in A2A, including polling for task status, streaming results via Server-Sent Events, and receiving asynchronous push notifications for long-running tasks.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/key-concepts.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Interaction Mechanisms:

1.  **Request/Response (Polling):**
    -   **Purpose:** Client sends a request and polls for task completion status.
    -   **Flow:** Client calls methods like `message/send`. If a task is long-running, the server may return a `working` status. The client then periodically calls `tasks/get` to check for terminal states (`completed`, `failed`).
    -   **Use Case:** Suitable for interactions where immediate results are not required or when managing stateful, long-running operations.

2.  **Streaming (Server-Sent Events - SSE):**
    -   **Purpose:** Server sends incremental results or real-time progress updates over a persistent HTTP connection.
    -   **Flow:** Client initiates with `message/stream`. Server responds with an open connection, sending SSEs like `Task`, `Message`, `TaskStatusUpdateEvent`, or `TaskArtifactUpdateEvent`.
    -   **Requirements:** Server must advertise `streaming` capability in its Agent Card.
    -   **Use Case:** Ideal for tasks producing results incrementally or requiring live progress feedback.

3.  **Push Notifications:**
    -   **Purpose:** Server sends asynchronous notifications (HTTP POST) to a client-provided webhook URL when task status changes significantly.
    -   **Flow:** Client provides a webhook URL via `tasks/pushNotificationConfig/set` or during task initiation. Server sends notifications for task completion, failure, or input requirements.
    -   **Requirements:** Server must advertise `pushNotifications` capability in its Agent Card.
    -   **Use Case:** Best for very long-running tasks or scenarios where maintaining a persistent connection is impractical.
```

TITLE: A2A Protocol Transport and Format
DESCRIPTION: Defines the communication protocols and data formats used by the Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol. It specifies the use of HTTP(S) for transport and JSON-RPC 2.0 for message payloads, with a mandatory Content-Type header.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
A2A Protocol Transport and Format:

Transport Protocol:
  - A2A communication MUST occur over HTTP(S).
  - The A2A Server exposes its service at a URL defined in its AgentCard.

Data Format:
  - A2A uses JSON-RPC 2.0 as the payload format for all requests and responses (excluding SSE stream wrapper).
  - Client requests and server responses MUST adhere to the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification.
  - The Content-Type header for HTTP requests and responses containing JSON-RPC payloads MUST be application/json.
```

```
}
```

TITLE: A2A Streaming Update Events
DESCRIPTION: Defines the structure of events used for streaming updates in the A2A protocol, including message, task status, and artifact updates.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/llms.txt#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
SendStreamingMessageResponse:
  type: "message"
  message: (Message) The message content.
  contextId: (string) Context identifier the message is associated with.
  kind: ("streaming-response") Type discriminator.
  final: (boolean) True if this is the final message for the task.

TaskStatusUpdateEvent:
  type: "task-status"
  taskId: (string) Task ID.
  contextId: (string) Context identifier the task is associated with.
  kind: ("status-update") Type discriminator.
  status: (TaskStatus) The new status object.
  final: (boolean) True if this is the terminal update for the task.

TaskArtifactUpdateEvent:
  type: "task-artifact"
  taskId: (string) Task ID.
  artifact: (Artifact) The artifact data.
  append: (boolean) If true, append parts to artifact; if false (default), replace.
  lastChunk: (boolean) If true, indicates this is the final update for the artifact.
  final: (boolean) Usually false for artifacts, can signal end concurrently with status.
```

TITLE: A2A Protocol: Client-Agent Interaction Flow
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a typical conversational flow using the A2A protocol, including a client sending an initial request, the agent responding with an artifact, and a subsequent client request referencing the previous artifact. This showcases the JSON RPC structure for messages and artifact handling.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/topics/life-of-a-task.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Client Sends Initial Message:
  Method: message/send
  Parameters:
    message: Object
      role: "user"
      parts: Array of Objects
        kind: "text"
        text: "Generate an image of a sailboat on the ocean."
  Example Request:
  {
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "req-001",
    "method": "message/send",
    "params": {
      "message": {
        "role": "user",
        "parts": [
          {
            "kind": "text",
            "text": "Generate an image of a sailboat on the ocean."
          }
        ],
        "messageId": "msg-user-001"
      }
    }
  }

Agent Responds with Artifact:
  Result Structure:
    id: String (task ID)
    contextId: String
    status: Object
      state: "completed"
    artifacts: Array of Objects
      artifactId: String
      name: String (e.g., "sailboat_image.png")
      description: String
      parts: Array of Objects
        kind: "file"
        file: Object
          name: String
          mimeType: String (e.g., "image/png")
          bytes: String (base64 encoded data)
    kind: "task"
  Example Response:
  {
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "req-001",
    "result": {
      "id": "task-boat-gen-123",
      "contextId": "ctx-conversation-abc",
      "status": {
        "state": "completed"
      },
      "artifacts": [
        {
          "artifactId": "artifact-boat-v1-xyz",
          "name": "sailboat_image.png",
          "description": "A generated image of a sailboat on the ocean.",
          "parts": [
            {
              "kind": "file",
              "file": {
                "name": "sailboat_image.png",
                "mimeType": "image/png",
                "bytes": "<base64_encoded_png_data_of_a_sailboat>"
              }
            }
          ]
        }
      ],
      "kind": "task"
    }
  }

Client Follow-up Request with Artifact Reference:
  Method: message/send
  Parameters:
    message: Object
      role: "user"
      messageId: String
      contextId: String (same as previous)
      referenceTaskIds: Array of Strings (optional, references previous task ID)
      parts: Array of Objects
        kind: "text"
        text: "That's great! Can you make the sailboat red?"
        metadata: Object (optional, for artifact referencing)
          referenceArtifacts: Array of Objects
            artifactId: String
            taskId: String
  Example Request:
  {
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "req-002",
    "method": "message/send",
    "params": {
      "message": {
        "role": "user",
        "messageId": "msg-user-002",
        "contextId": "ctx-conversation-abc",
        "referenceTaskIds": ["task-boat-gen-123"],
        "parts": [
          {
            "kind": "text",
            "text": "That's great! Can you make the sailboat red?"
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }
```

TITLE: A2A RPC: Message Operations
DESCRIPTION: Handles sending messages to initiate or continue tasks, supporting both synchronous request/response and asynchronous streaming updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE).

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/llms.txt#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
message/send: (Request/Response)
  Description: Sends a message to initiate or continue a task.
  Params: MessageSendParams (includes taskId, contextId, message, optionally configuration).
  Result: Task (final state after synchronous processing).

message/stream: (Request/Stream)
  Description: Sends a message and subscribes to real-time updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE).
  Params: MessageSendParams.
  Result (stream events): SendStreamingMessageResponse containing one of: MessageEvent, TaskStatusUpdateEvent, TaskArtifactUpdateEvent. Final event has final: true.
```

TITLE: JSON-RPC Structures
DESCRIPTION: Details the standard JSON-RPC 2.0 structures used for A2A requests and responses, including error handling.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
JSONRPCRequest Object:
  - jsonrpc: String, MUST be "2.0". Specifies the JSON-RPC protocol version.
  - method: String, the name of the method to invoke (e.g., "message/send").
  - params: Structured value (typically object) holding parameter values. MAY be omitted if method expects no parameters.
  - id: String, Number, or NULL. Identifier for correlating requests and responses. MUST NOT be NULL for requests expecting a response. Numbers SHOULD NOT contain fractional parts.

JSONRPCResponse Object:
  - jsonrpc: String, MUST be "2.0". Specifies the JSON-RPC protocol version.
  - id: REQUIRED. MUST be the same as the Request Object's id. MUST be null if request id was undetectable.
  - result: REQUIRED on success. MUST NOT exist if there was an error. Value determined by the invoked method.
  - error: REQUIRED on failure. MUST NOT exist if there was no error. Value MUST be a JSONRPCError object.
  - The members `result` and `error` are mutually exclusive.

JSONRPCError Object:
  - code: Integer, a number that indicates the error type.
  - message: String, a String providing a short description of the error.
  - data: Optional. A primitive or structured value that contains additional information about the error.

Protocol RPC Method Invocation:
  - A2A RPC methods are invoked by sending an HTTP POST request to the A2A Server's url.
  - The request body MUST be a JSONRPCRequest object.
  - The Content-Type header MUST be application/json.
  - The A2A Server's HTTP response body MUST be a JSONRPCResponse object or an SSE stream for streaming methods.
  - The Content-Type for JSON-RPC responses is application/json. For SSE streams, it is text/event-stream.
```

TITLE: A2A Protocol Communication Standard
DESCRIPTION: The Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol uses JSON-RPC 2.0 over HTTP(S) for standardized communication between agents. It supports various interaction patterns including synchronous request/response, Server-Sent Events (SSE) for streaming, and asynchronous push notifications.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
APIDOC:
  Protocol: JSON-RPC 2.0 over HTTP(S)
  Features:
    - Agent Discovery: Via 'Agent Cards' detailing capabilities and connection info.
    - Interaction Modalities:
      - Synchronous Request/Response
      - Streaming (Server-Sent Events - SSE)
      - Asynchronous Push Notifications
    - Data Exchange:
      - Text
      - Files
      - Structured JSON
  Key Concepts:
    - AgentCard: A descriptor for an agent's capabilities and connection details.
    - Skills: Specific functionalities an agent can perform.
  Future Enhancements:
    - Formalize authorization schemes and optional credentials in AgentCard.
    - Introduce a `QuerySkill()` method for dynamic skill checking.
    - Support dynamic UX negotiation within a task.
    - Explore client-initiated methods.
    - Improve streaming reliability and push notification mechanisms.
```

TITLE: A2A Protocol Error Codes
DESCRIPTION: Lists standard JSON-RPC error codes and A2A-specific error codes encountered during protocol operations.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/llms.txt#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
Standard Error Codes:
  -32700: JSONParseError - Invalid JSON payload.
  -32600: InvalidRequestError - Invalid JSON-RPC request object.
  -32601: MethodNotFoundError - Method does not exist.
  -32602: InvalidParamsError - Invalid method parameters.
  -32603: InternalError - Internal server error.

A2A Specific Error Codes:
  -32001: TaskNotFoundError - Specified task ID not found.
  -32002: TaskNotCancelableError - Task is in a terminal state and cannot be canceled.
  -32003: PushNotificationNotSupportedError - Agent does not support push notifications.
  -32004: UnsupportedOperationError - The requested operation is not supported.
  -32005: ContentTypeNotSupportedError - Mismatch in supported content types.
  -32006: InvalidAgentResponseError - Agent generated an invalid response for the requested method.
```

LANGUAGE: typescript

```
/**
 * Provides a declaration of a combination of the target url and the supported transport to interact with the agent.
 */
interface AgentInterface {
  /**
   * The URL for the agent's interface.
   */
  url: string;
  /**
   * The transport protocol used for this interface (e.g., 'http', 'grpc', 'websocket').

  transport: string;

}
```

TITLE: SecurityScheme Object Structure
DESCRIPTION: Describes the authentication requirements for accessing the agent's `url` endpoint. This includes the type of scheme and its parameters.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
/**
 * Describes the authentication requirements for accessing the agent's `url` endpoint.
 */
interface SecurityScheme {
  /**
   * The type of security scheme (e.g., 'apiKey', 'oauth2', 'http', 'mutualTls').
   */
  type: string;
  /**
   * A description of the security scheme.
   */
  description?: string;
  /**
   * Parameters specific to the security scheme (e.g., bearerFormat for http, flows for oauth2).
   */
  // The actual structure of 'parameters' is highly dependent on the 'type' and is often defined by OpenAPI/Swagger specifications.
  // For example, for 'apiKey', it might include 'name' and 'in'. For 'oauth2', it would include 'flows'.
  parameters?: any;
}
```

TITLE: Sample Agent Card Structure
DESCRIPTION: Defines the JSON structure for an agent card, providing metadata about an agent. This includes its name, description, supported protocols (JSONRPC, GRPC, HTTP+JSON), capabilities, security schemes, and skills.

```
{
  "protocolVersion": "0.2.9",
  "name": "GeoSpatial Route Planner Agent",
  "description": "Provides advanced route planning, traffic analysis, and custom map generation services. This agent can calculate optimal routes, estimate travel times considering real-time traffic, and create personalized maps with points of interest.",
  "url": "https://georoute-agent.example.com/a2a/v1",
  "preferredTransport": "JSONRPC",
  "additionalInterfaces" : [
    {"url": "https://georoute-agent.example.com/a2a/v1", "transport": "JSONRPC"},
    {"url": "https://georoute-agent.example.com/a2a/grpc", "transport": "GRPC"},
    {"url": "https://georoute-agent.example.com/a2a/json", "transport": "HTTP+JSON"}
  ],
  "provider": {
    "organization": "Example Geo Services Inc.",
    "url": "https://www.examplegeoservices.com"
  },
  "iconUrl": "https://georoute-agent.example.com/icon.png",
  "version": "1.2.0",
  "documentationUrl": "https://docs.examplegeoservices.com/georoute-agent/api",
  "capabilities": {
    "streaming": true,
    "pushNotifications": true,
    "stateTransitionHistory": false
  },
  "securitySchemes": {
    "google": {
      "type": "openIdConnect",
      "openIdConnectUrl": "https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration"
    }
  },
  "security": [{ "google": ["openid", "profile", "email"] }],
  "defaultInputModes": ["application/json", "text/plain"],
  "defaultOutputModes": ["application/json", "image/png"],
  "skills": [
    {
      "id": "route-optimizer-traffic",
      "name": "Traffic-Aware Route Optimizer",
      "description": "Calculates the optimal driving route between two or more locations, taking into account real-time traffic conditions, road closures, and user preferences (e.g., avoid tolls, prefer highways).",
      "tags": ["maps", "routing", "navigation", "directions", "traffic"],
      "examples": [
        "Plan a route from '1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA' to 'San Francisco International Airport' avoiding tolls.",
        "{\"origin\": {\"lat\": 37.422, \"lng\": -122.084}, \"destination\": {\"lat\": 37.7749, \"lng\": -122.4194}, \"preferences\": [\"avoid_ferries\"]}"
      ],
      "inputModes": ["application/json", "text/plain"],
      "outputModes": [
        "application/json",
        "application/vnd.geo+json",
        "text/html"
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "custom-map-generator",
      "name": "Personalized Map Generator",
      "description": "Creates custom map images or interactive map views based on user-defined points of interest, routes, and style preferences. Can overlay data layers.",
      "tags": ["maps", "customization", "visualization", "cartography"],
      "examples": [
        "Generate a map of my upcoming road trip with all planned stops highlighted.",
        "Show me a map visualizing all coffee shops within a 1-mile radius of my current location."
      ],
      "inputModes": ["application/json"],
      "outputModes": [
        "image/png",
        "image/jpeg",
        "application/json",
        "text/html"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "supportsAuthenticatedExtendedCard": true
}
```

TITLE: A2A In-Task Authentication (Secondary Credentials)
DESCRIPTION: Details the process for handling secondary authentication requirements during task execution. If an agent needs credentials for a different system, it transitions the task to 'auth-required' and provides details in TaskStatus.message.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: APIDOC
CODE:
```
In-Task Authentication:
1. State Transition: Agent SHOULD transition A2A task to 'auth-required' state.
2. Information Provision: TaskStatus.message (e.g., DataPart) SHOULD detail secondary authentication needs (e.g., PushNotificationAuthenticationInfo-like structure).
3. Credential Handling: A2A Client obtains new credentials out-of-band and provides them in a subsequent message/send or message/stream request.
```

TITLE: A2A Message Send with Push Notification Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a client sending a message to initiate a long-running task and configuring a webhook for push notifications upon completion. Includes the JSON RPC request structure and the server's acknowledgment.

SOURCE: https://github.com/google/a2a/blob/main/docs/specification.md#_snippet_62

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": "req-005",
  "method": "message/send",
  "params": {
```
